themes: Call for cooperative and horizontal governance
Opposition to commodification and commercialization of culture
Equity and diversity in funding and access
Disconnect between community needs and institutional practices
key_phrases: more practice of horizontal and cooperative decision making
beyond 'hearing voices' and asking these surveys
actively giving decision making to your own staff, and public
rely less on top down structures
eliminate the extractive commodification and commercialization of our culture
lead conversations and practices on solidarity economy in the arts
eliminating the hierarchy within our local artist community
help be a part of a just transition
creatives...a means to enable liberation for themselves and their greater community
give creatives the ability to hold and maintain their power
not used as bait to attract capital or investors who often displace communities
barriers_identified: extractive commodification and commercialization of culture
decisions made without meaningful community participation
focus on revenue generation for tourism or economic development
lack of spaces that invite and provide opportunity regardless of profit potential
solutions_proposed: implement horizontal and cooperative decision making
give decision making power to staff and public
embrace cooperative decision making with equity and diversity lens
eliminate extractive commodification and commercialization of culture
lead conversations and practices on solidarity economy in the arts
eliminate hierarchy within local artist community
enable creatives to hold and maintain their power
provide spaces for creative expression regardless of profit
value creative lives on their own terms
